instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - no audio device
threads.message:
Hello,

Currently working on the one from topic title with no audio device issue (originally won't boot).

First of all, tried known working OS - no luck. Checked MLB under microscope and found that <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> looks strange - measured it and power bus was shorted to ground so I have removed <CHIP>U6400</CHIP>. I spotted underneath that someone has attempted to make some "unsuccessful" work here, found ripped off C5 pad (NC) and a bit corroded D5 pad (<SIGNAL>AUD_SPKRAMP_INT_L</SIGNAL>). Removed the signs of corrosion and tested MLB - still no audio device present. Replaced <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R6228</RESISTOR> (this resistor looked like overheated and had only 20 Ohms despite it is 33 Ohms). Neext I found <SIGNAL>AUD_SPKRAMP_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> to be High, power rails for <CHIP>U6200</CHIP> correct. <RESISTOR>R6203</RESISTOR> - 0V and no oscillograms on both pins, value 33 Ohm, 540mV on diode test (red probe to resistor, black to GND), shouldn't be some data visible over here?

My main question: should <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> be assembled to get the audio device visible in the OS? If not, what is the next step in diagnosing of such problem?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - no audio device
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6400</CHIP> shouldn't be invloved in the communication between PCH and audio codec.
Check the series resistors between PCH and <CHIP>U6200</CHIP>.
